author: Staff Reporter
text:
A petrol bomb was thrown at a house in Amman Kovil Street at Bryant Nagar here on Saturday night.

M. Sulaiman (56), running a hotel at Chidambara Nagar, lodged a police complaint stating that three identified persons, who came on a two-wheeler, threw a petrol bomb at his house around 11 p.m. and fled the scene. Window curtains in the house caught fire in the attack, but nobody was injured.

Police sources said that the attack could be the result of the rivalry between Periyasami and Anand, who were in the administrative body of a temple located in the street.

The assailants wanted to attack a particular house in the street. But they attacked Sulaiman’s house which was adjacent to it, sources said.

Thoothukudi South police have filed a case under Section 436 of the Indian Penal Code and Section 3 of the Explosive Substances Act.

Two suspects have been secured in this connection and police are questioning them.
title: Petrol bomb hurled at house in Thoothukudi
